title: Lady Bird
consensus: Livers fresh insights about the turmoil of adolescence -- and reveals writer-director greta gerwig as a fully formed filmmaking talent.

title: A Ghost Story
consensus: Ftly manages its ambitious themes through an inventive, artful, and ultimately poignant exploration of love and loss.

title: Columbus
consensus: Lances the clean lines of architecture against the messiness of love, with tenderly moving results.

title: Graduation (Bacalaureat)
consensus: Rks yet another well-written and powerfully acted look at morality and societal decay from writer-director cristian mungiu.

title: Truman
consensus: Kes an affecting look at a long friendship separated by distance but undimmed by time.

title: Your Name. (Kimi No Na Wa.)
consensus: Ds another outstanding chapter to writer-director makoto shinkai's filmography.

title: Dolores
consensus: Earths overlooked history to spotlight one of activism's most powerful -- and often forgotten -- voices, dolores huerta.

title: Menashe
consensus: Fers an intriguing look at a culture whose unfamiliarity to many viewers will be rendered irrelevant by the story's universally affecting themes and thoughtful approach.

title: Quest
consensus: Es one family's experiences to offer trenchant, wide-ranging observations about modern american life.

title: Jane
consensus: Nors its subject's legacy with an absorbing, beautifully filmed, and overall enlightening look at her decades of invaluable work.

title: Good Time
consensus: a singularly distinctive crime drama offering far more than the usual genre thrills.

title: The Red Turtle (La tortue rouge)
consensus: Ds to studio ghibli's estimable legacy with a beautifully animated effort whose deceptively simple story boasts narrative layers as richly absorbing as its lovely visuals.

title: The Work
consensus: Kes a gut-wrenching look at lives all too often written off as lost causes, persuasively arguing that growth and change can be waiting where we least expect it.

title: Obit
consensus: Ines an entertaining -- and overdue -- spotlight on an engaging group of people whose singular craft is too often taken for granted.

title: Icarus
consensus: eye-opening viewing for professional sports enthusiasts, yet it should also prove thoroughly gripping even for filmgoers who might not necessarily be drawn to the subject.

title: The Other Side of Hope (Toivon tuolla puolen)
consensus: Ffering a timely drama whose melancholy air is leavened by its empathy.

title: All This Panic
consensus: Fers an unvarnished look at the lives of young american women whose less compelling moments are more than balanced out by documentarian jenny gage's empathetic approach.

title: Maudie
consensus: Talented cast -- particularly sally hawkins in the title role -- breathe much-needed depth into a story that only skims the surface of a fascinating life and talent.

title: Silence
consensus: Ds martin scorsese's decades-long creative quest with a thoughtful, emotionally resonant look at spirituality and human nature that stands among the director's finest works.

title: Land of Mine (Under Sandet)
consensus: Es an oft-forgotten chapter from the aftermath of world war ii to tell a hard-hitting story whose period setting belies its timeless observations about bloodshed and forgiveness.

title: Okja
genres: Action & Adventure | Drama | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: Es bong joon-ho continuing to create defiantly eclectic entertainment -- and still hitting more than enough of his narrative targets in the midst of a tricky tonal juggling act.

title: Brawl in Cell Block 99
consensus: Des a committed vince vaughn performance into the brutally violent -- and undeniably entertaining -- depths of prison-set grindhouse genre fare.

title: Human Flow
consensus: Fers a singularly expansive -- and sobering -- perspective on the global refugee crisis.

title: Abacus: Small Enough to Jail
consensus: Anscends its less-than-dramatic trappings to present a gripping real-life legal thriller with far-reaching implications.

title: Frantz
consensus: Nds writer-director françois ozon thoughtfully probing the aftermath of world war i through the memories and relationships of loved ones left behind.

title: Detroit
consensus: Livers a gut-wrenching -- and essential -- dramatization of a tragic chapter from america's past that draws distressing parallels to the present.

title: Battle of the Sexes
consensus: Rns real-life events into a crowd-pleasing, well-acted dramedy that ably entertains while smartly serving up a volley of present-day parallels.

title: Girls Trip
consensus: the rare r-rated comedy that pushes boundaries to truly comedic effect -- and anchors its laughs in compelling characters brought to life by a brilliantly assembled cast.

title: Prevenge
genres: Art House & International | Comedy | Drama | Horror | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: Ould thrill fans of pitch-black horror-comedy -- and open untold opportunities for writer/director/star alice lowe.

title: Their Finest
consensus: Oothly combines comedy and wartime drama to crowd-pleasing effect.

title: Darkest Hour
consensus: held together by gary oldman's electrifying performance, which brings winston churchill to life even when the movie's narrative falters.

title: The Lost City of Z
consensus: Stately pace and visual grandeur hearken back to classic exploration epics, and charlie hunnam turns in a masterful performance as its complex protagonist.

title: Wind River
consensus: Res viewers into a character-driven mystery with smart writing, a strong cast, and a skillfully rendered setting that delivers the bitter chill promised by its title.

title: 20th Century Women
consensus: Fers annette bening a too-rare opportunity to shine in a leading role -- and marks another assured step forward for writer-director mike mills.

title: The Women's Balcony (Ismach Hatani)
consensus: Ckles complicated subjects with intelligence, compassion, and wit.

title: A Monster Calls
genres: Comedy | Drama | Kids & Family | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: Ftly balances dark themes and fantastical elements to deliver an engrossing and uncommonly moving entry in the crowded coming-of-age genre.

title: A Quiet Passion
consensus: Fers a finely detailed portrait of a life whose placid passage may not have been inherently cinematic, but is made more affecting by cynthia nixon's strong performance.

title: Lady Macbeth
consensus: Ashes some surprising toughness beneath its period exterior, bolstered by a mesmerizing -- and unforgiving -- central performance by florence pugh.

title: The B-Side: Elsa Dorfman's Portrait Photography
consensus: Fers an intriguing glimpse at a distinctive artist's work that's as warmly engaging as its subject.

title: Raw
consensus: Lurid violence and sexuality live up to its title, but they're anchored with an immersive atmosphere and deep symbolism that linger long after the provocative visuals fade.

title: The Breadwinner
consensus: Stunning visuals are matched by a story that dares to confront sobering real-life issues with uncommon -- and richly rewarding -- honesty.

title: The Meyerowitz Stories (New and Selected)
consensus: Serves the family dynamic through writer-director noah baumbach's bittersweet lens and the impressive efforts of a remarkable cast.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2
genres: Action & Adventure | Comedy | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: Action-packed plot, dazzling visuals, and irreverent humor add up to a sequel that's almost as fun -- if not quite as thrillingly fresh -- as its predecessor.

title: Thelma
consensus: Ays with genre tropes in unexpected ways, delivering a thoughtfully twisty supernatural thriller with a lingering impact.

title: John Wick: Chapter 2
consensus: Es what a sequel should -- which in this case means doubling down on the non-stop, thrillingly choreographed action that made its predecessor so much fun.

title: Stronger
consensus: Ses on the power of its well-chosen ensemble to offer an emotionally resonant fact-based story that transcends inspirational drama clichés.

title: It
consensus: Plifies the horror in stephen king's classic story without losing touch with its heart.

title: American Made
consensus: Fast-and-loose attitude with its real-life story mirrors the cavalier -- and delightfully watchable -- energy tom cruise gives off in the leading role.

title: It Comes At Night
consensus: Kes lethally effective use of its bare-bones trappings while proving once again that what's left unseen can be just as horrifying as anything on the screen.

title: Step
consensus: Lls an irresistibly crowd-pleasing story in a thoroughly absorbing way -- and while smartly incorporating a variety of timely themes.

title: Dina
consensus: Esents a clear-eyed and uncommonly detailed view of one couple's relationship, offering insights as broadly illuminating as they are compassionate.

title: Whose Streets?
consensus: Kes a close-up look at the civil unrest that erupted after a shocking act of violence in ferguson, missouri - and the decades of simmering tension leading up to it.

title: Trophy
consensus: Fers a thought-provoking look at big-game hunting that should challenge, trouble, and enrage viewers regardless of their personal perspective.

title: In This Corner of the World (Kono sekai no katasumi ni)
consensus: Fers a unique ground-level perspective on an oft-dramatized period in history, further distinguished by beautiful hand-drawn animation.

title: I, Daniel Blake
consensus: Rks yet another well-told chapter in director ken loach's powerfully populist filmography.

title: After the Storm (Umi yori mo mada fukaku)
consensus: Osses cultural lines to offer timeless observations about parental responsibilities, personal bonds, and the capacity for forgiveness.

title: Kedi
consensus: a cat fancier's dream, but this thoughtful, beautifully filmed look at istanbul's street feline population offers absorbing viewing for filmgoers of any purr-suasion.

title: The Lego Batman Movie
genres: Action & Adventure | Animation | Comedy | Kids & Family
consensus: Ntinues its block-buster franchise's winning streak with another round of dizzyingly funny -- and beautifully animated -- family-friendly mayhem.

title: BPM (Beats Per Minute) (120 battements par minute)
consensus: Fers an engrossing look at a pivotal period in history that lingers long after the closing credits roll.

title: City of Ghosts
consensus: Kes a hard-hitting, ground-level look at atrocities in a part of the world that may seem foreign to many viewers, but whose impact will be no less devastating.

title: My Life as a Zucchini (Ma vie de courgette)
genres: Animation | Art House & International | Kids & Family
consensus: Silly title and adorable characters belie a sober story whose colorful visuals delight the senses even as it braves dark emotional depths.

title: Faces Places (Visages, villages)
consensus: a unique cross-generational portrait of life in rural france from the great agnès varda.

title: Mudbound
consensus: Fers a well-acted, finely detailed snapshot of american history whose scenes of rural class struggle resonate far beyond their period setting.

title: The Disaster Artist
consensus: a surprisingly poignant and charming movie-about-a-movie that explores the creative process with unexpected delicacy.

title: God's Own Country
consensus: Rks an outstanding directorial debut for francis lee.

title: Blade Runner 2049
genres: Action & Adventure | Drama | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: Epens and expands its predecessor's story while standing as an impressive filmmaking achievement in its own right.

title: The Salesman (Forushande)
genres: Art House & International | Drama | Mystery & Suspense
consensus: Kes an ambitiously complex look at thought-provoking themes, and the well-acted results prove another consistently absorbing entry in writer-director asghar farhadi's distinguished filmography.

title: Hidden Figures
consensus: Lebrates overlooked -- and crucial -- contributions from a pivotal moment in american history.

title: I Am Not Your Negro
consensus: Fers an incendiary snapshot of james baldwin's crucial observations on american race relations -- and a sobering reminder of how far we've yet to go.

title: War for the Planet of the Apes
genres: Action & Adventure | Drama | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: Mbines breathtaking special effects and a powerful, poignant narrative to conclude this rebooted trilogy on a powerful -- and truly blockbuster -- note.

title: Spider-Man: Homecoming
genres: Action & Adventure | Drama | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: Es whatever a second reboot can, delivering a colorful, fun adventure that fits snugly in the sprawling mcu without getting bogged down in franchise-building.

title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
consensus: Ftly balances black comedy against searing drama -- and draws unforgettable performances from its veteran cast along the way.

title: Logan Lucky
consensus: Rks a welcome end to steven soderbergh's retirement -- and proves he hasn't lost his ability to entertain.

title: Thor: Ragnarok
genres: Action & Adventure | Drama | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: a colorful cosmic adventure that sets a new standard for its franchise -- and the rest of the marvel cinematic universe.

title: Baby Driver
consensus: Ts the road and it's gone -- proving fast-paced action movies can be smartly written without sacrificing thrills.

title: The Florida Project
consensus: Fers a colorfully empathetic look at an underrepresented part of the population that proves absorbing even as it raises sobering questions about modern america.

title: The Shape of Water
consensus: Nds guillermo del toro at his visually distinctive best -- and matched by an emotionally absorbing story brought to life by a stellar sally hawkins performance.

title: Star Wars: The Last Jedi
genres: Action & Adventure | Drama | Science Fiction & Fantasy
consensus: Nors the saga's rich legacy while adding some surprising twists -- and delivering all the emotion-rich action fans could hope for.

title: Get Out
consensus: Amlessly weaves its trenchant social critiques into a brilliantly effective and entertaining horror/comedy thrill ride.

title: The Big Sick
consensus: Es its appealing leads and cross-cultural themes to prove the standard romcom formula still has some fresh angles left to explore.

title: Dunkirk
consensus: Rves up emotionally satisfying spectacle, delivered by a writer-director in full command of his craft and brought to life by a gifted ensemble cast that honors the fact-based story.

title: Coco
consensus: Rich visual pleasures are matched by a thoughtful narrative that takes a family-friendly -- and deeply affecting -- approach to questions of culture, family, life, and death.
